sentences.english: We could seetheblood vesselsinhis temple pulsate ashe became more angry.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以看到血管搏動他的廟宇，他變得更加憤怒。

sentences.english: At the left is a temple dedicated to the Roman emperor Hadrian.
sentences.chinese: 左邊是一座紀念古羅馬哈德里安大帝的廟宇。

sentences.english: Rani Rasmani, the foundress of the temple garden, passed away in 1861.
sentences.chinese: 廟宇花園的創辦者拉妮羅曼妮於1861年去世。

sentences.english: The temple's most breathtaking feature is a towering pagoda.
sentences.chinese: 廟宇最讓人驚歎的地方是一座巍峨的寶塔。

sentences.english: The building of this house in the shape of the temple was a rich man's vagary .
sentences.chinese: 這棟房屋廟宇式的外形，是一位富人的奇想。

sentences.english: He shall break also the images of Bethshemesh, that is in the land of Egypt; and the houses of the gods of the Egyptians shall he burn with fire.
sentences.chinese: 他必打碎埃及地伯示麥的柱像，用火焚燒神的廟宇。

sentences.english: There are many sacred / holy shrines in the Near East.
sentences.chinese: 在近東地區有許多神聖莊嚴的廟宇。

sentences.english: Natural beauty is an all- pervading presence. The universe is its temple.
sentences.chinese: 自然的美麗是無處不再的，世界就是它的廟宇。

sentences.english: Captain Tong makes his way upstream toward the magnificent temple called Shibaozhai or Stone Precious Temple.
sentences.chinese: 佟船長速將前往的宏偉廟宇名叫石寶寨。

sentences.english: The grand procession moves slowly out of the temple.
sentences.chinese: 莊嚴的遊行隊伍緩緩地走出廟宇。

sentences.english: The larger one features four huge, 20-m-high statues of Pharaoh himself.
sentences.chinese: 其中一座廟宇有四個20米高的法老王他本人的塑像。

sentences.english: This temple calls "Guanyin temple", the home position to love the order village.
sentences.chinese: 該廟宇叫“南海觀音廟”，原位於愛秩序村。

sentences.english: The remoteness of this beautiful temple only makes it more appealing.
sentences.chinese: 這座美麗的廟宇地處偏遠，恰恰使它更具吸引力。

sentences.english: Captain Tong is heading toward the city of ghosts, a temple overlooking the port of Feng Du.
sentences.chinese: 佟船長要前往鬼城，這是豐都上方的一座廟宇。

sentences.english: A building used for the worship of a god or gods in some religions.
sentences.chinese: 指供奉神佛的廟宇，有時也指其他宗教的修道院。

definition: among the people/popular/folk/non-governmental/involving people rather than governments
to arrange/to set out/to decorate/to display/decorative items
Taoist or Buddhist rite/abbr. for 菩提道場|菩提道场[Pu2 ti2 dao4 chang3]
